description.lang: FIBARO Button is a compact, battery-powered, Z-Wave Plus compatible device. It allows you to control devices through the Z-Wave network and run various scenes defined in FIBARO System. Different actions may be triggered with one to five clicks or by holding the button down. In Panic Button mode, each press of the button results in triggering the Fibaro Alarm. With its small design and wireless communication, the FIBARO Button can be conveniently mounted on any surface and in any position or location at home, e.g. beside the bed or under the desk.
Lifelinereports the device status and allows for assigning single device only (main controller by default).
On/Offis assigned to clicking the button and is used to turn on/off associated devices.
Dimmeris assigned to holding the button and is used to change level of associated devices.
Alarm is assigned to clicking and/or holding the button (triggers are defined in parameter 30) and is used to send alarm frames to associated devices.

name.lang: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode

description.lang: This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It does not apply to 1st Lifeline group.1 - 2nd group sent as secure2 - 3rd group sent as secure4 - 4th group sent as secureNOTEValues of parameter 3 may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that 2nd & 3rd group are sent as secure.
